before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"edoen","text":"Allow PAS reagents to come to room temperature for ~30 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"es2dg","text":"Scope:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9bhpo","text":"The PAS stain is used to demonstrate polysaccharides such as glycogen, and mucosubstances such as glycoproteins, glycolipids and mucins in tissues.  It is used as a replacement for the H\u0026E in kidney pathology.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"66e8m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aeh7b","text":"Expected Outcome:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fd6oa","text":"Intermyofibrillar Network…………………………..Pink to Rose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4l08t","text":"Glycogen………………………………………………….…..Pink to Rose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"md8l","text":"Myofibrils……………………………………………………..Unstained","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"85ke3","text":"Type I fibers………………………………………………….Lighter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dbpog","text":"Type II fibers…………………………………………………Darker","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"829sn","text":"Blood Vessel walls \u0026 connective tissue…..Faintly Stained","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bp865","text":"1. Leftover matrix will change the pH of the solutions and prevent adequate staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c7l5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7033g","text":"2. Bubbles left on tissue will prevent acquisition of high-quality microscopy images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: References: 1. Luna, Lee (ed.). Manual of histological staining methods of the Armed Forces Institute of Pathology. 2. Dubowitz, B. Muscle Biopsy. A practical approach, 2nd edition, Bailliere, Tindall, London, 1985. 3. Dr. Fogo Clinical lab PAS protocol.
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"5pbn6","text":"Reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ckbs","text":"1.  Commercial kit AbCam 150680","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f76fp","text":"2.  Ethanol, Fisher BP2818500","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bst82","text":"3.  Hematoxylin Solution, Mayer’s, Sigma MHS32-1L","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8hg9","text":"4.  Xylenes, Histological Grade, Sigma 534056","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14ul6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5v6m","text":"Materials:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82jg7","text":"1.  Easy Dip Slide Staining Jars, Mercedes Medical SIM M90012AS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"186sm","text":"2.  Coplin Dish Staining Dish, Fisher S17495","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs5g8","text":"3.  Microscope Cover Slips, Creative Waste Solutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92j9o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l78m","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1v963","text":"Solutions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f14ch","text":"1.  0.5% Periodic Acid: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai1kq","text":"       Periodic Acid…………….5g","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"623pc","text":"       Distilled Water….1000mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50e5r","text":"       Pour out what is needed and reuse for ~1 month","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ae69","text":"       Store at room temperature for 6 months","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"329q2","text":"2.  Schiff’s Reagent – Commercially Prepared","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30mc1","text":"       Richard Allan Scientific Catalog number: 88017","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ld18","text":"       Solution may be reused for ~1 month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bc8m","text":"       ***Check for effectiveness by placing 3 drops of formalin in 2mL Schiff’s reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p39t","text":"            The solution should immediately turn purple. Follow manufacturer expiration date on bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tslt","text":"3.  Stock of 0.5% Ammonium Hydroxide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chi70","text":"        2.5mL of Ammonium Hydroxide","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4um62","text":"        497.5mL Milli-Q H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":25,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf2eo","text":"4.  Hematoxylin (filtered at least 1x/week)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajtoi","text":"5.  Ethanol solutions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8r12v","text":"        70% - 350mL EtOH + 150mL Milli-Q H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":42,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbq0t","text":"        95% - 350mL EtOH + 25mL Milli-Q H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":41,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5chde","text":"Allow PAS “kit” to come to room temperature on the bench.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gniu","text":"For paraffin sections, deparaffinize in xylene, two changes,    each.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bolfo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"CBF84200978511E991A38D625A1A1857","id":"82631","label":"","pause":null,"protocol_name":"PAS Staining on Fresh Frozen or Paraffin Embedded Tissue","start":null,"step_guid":"9F4CDE10977A11E991A38D625A1A1857","step_number":"2"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmh72","text":"Hydrate through graded alcohols,    each:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f0ffv","text":"100%, 100%, 95%, 70%, water ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"90bh9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"4E5B5AA0979211E991A38D625A1A1857","id":"82632","label":"","pause":null,"protocol_name":"PAS Staining on Fresh Frozen or Paraffin Embedded Tissue","start":null,"step_guid":"AA4A2160977A11E991A38D625A1A1857","step_number":"3"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f85d3","text":"Rinse well in distilled water by holding finger over slides, pouring water into sink and adding water.  Do this 5 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"da0c2","text":"Remove frozen slides from freezer and let equilibrate to room temperature, and then place in 10% Formalin for   . Proceed to step 7.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":110,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7q426","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4190m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"1BDBB820CB7411E9B8D6EFB61F3413F6","id":"82633","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"da0c2","text":"If staining is performed following MALDI analysis and samples have matrix on them, remove matrix in 90% ethanol (~2-3 min or until matrix is gone)    then in 70% ethanol for    . Proceed to step 7.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":147,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":175,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7q426","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b6sok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"10n05","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5m1t4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"3C4069D0CB7411E9B8D6EFB61F3413F6","id":"82634","label":"Until Matrix is removed","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"62362030CB7411E9B8D6EFB61F3413F6","id":"82635","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"citq1","text":"Rinse with distilled water (follow Step 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv0dl","text":"Place in 0.5% Periodic acid for    (to oxidize).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"aj0up","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a6ht4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"F96E7100978511E991A38D625A1A1857","id":"82636","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"protocol_name":"PAS Staining on Fresh Frozen or Paraffin Embedded Tissue","start":null,"step_guid":"5623FDA0978311E991A38D625A1A1857","step_number":"7"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dbt2k","text":"Rinse well in distilled water (follow Step 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73faj","text":"Pour Schiff’s reagent into Coplin jar containing slides.  Allow to sit 15-30 minutes at room temperature (kidney samples ~30 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ld9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"49u9s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dac0","text":"Rinse in running warm (~40 °C) distilled or tap water (follow Step 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"19c6g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61f58","text":"The tissue should appear pink after rinsing with warm water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"66uq0","text":"Place slides in movable gray slide holder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b253j","text":"Counterstain in Hematoxylin (staining line) for   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"aegsq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"0B19C1C0978611E991A38D625A1A1857","id":"82637","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"protocol_name":"PAS Staining on Fresh Frozen or Paraffin Embedded Tissue","start":null,"step_guid":"B347D510978311E991A38D625A1A1857","step_number":"12"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"du5e1","text":"Rinse well in distilled water, starting with blue container next to hematoxylin (follow Step 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1k56d","text":"Quickly dip slides into “Bluing” agent (0.5% ammonium hydroxide).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8teqv","text":"Rinse 1 minute in distilled water until pink color is visible (follow Step 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgrvi","text":"Dehydrate through graded alcohols, 10 short dips in each:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"290i9","text":"95%, 95%, 100%, 100%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"542o5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"494p4","text":"If the last 100% ethanol rinse is colored by residual stain, additional washing in new 100% ethanol solution should be performed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bo8dk","text":"Fix in 2 rounds of xylenes,    each (in the hood).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"c18h9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"71F933C0979111E991A38D625A1A1857","id":"82638","label":"","pause":null,"protocol_name":"PAS Staining on Fresh Frozen or Paraffin Embedded Tissue","start":null,"step_guid":"0154E950978411E991A38D625A1A1857","step_number":"17"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7tef","text":"Coverslip slides:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bpa2t","text":"Place coverslip on paper towel","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bu83c","text":"Add 2-3 drops of cytoseal to edge (depending on size)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bcq98","text":"Dip slide into xylenes, take out and roll the xylene lengthwise on slide","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"71d32","text":"Line up slide and cover slip and slowly place the slide on the coverslip","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5k6ic","text":"If needed, use dissecting tool to remove bubbles","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"94s1g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eabu9","text":"Image slides using a Leica brightfield scanner, AxioScan Z1 slide scanner (or equivalent) at 20x (~1 µm spatial resolution) and save as .tiff or .jpg file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcj7k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmpl2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"1urfq","text":"1.  Safety glasses or goggles, proper gloves, and a lab coat required. The area should be adequately vented and a lab mat placed underneath all solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cdkls","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8fs7t","text":"2.  Xylenes should be used in the fume hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
